quote: I am a businessman because I am good at business. But big cats are my first love.
I'm an actor first and foremost; it's my first love and passion.

I haven't modelled since I was 12 - that was a one-time thing, and I did it as a kid to make a little money to save up for university. Acting is my first love as well as writing and eventually producing and directing.

I want to go wherever there's great work. I'm a huge fan of film primarily. But you can get a great TV show and get attached to it. Making a great film is forever, though, so I always want to be part of film. It's my first love.

No, the horror genre is not my first love. I don't run to the theater to see horror films.

Doing comedy is still in my veins; that's my first love.
Up until I started on YouTube, my first love was musical theater.
Action is my first love. When I first started writing, my favorite movies were 'Raiders of the Lost Ark' and 'Aliens', and that sort of thing.

I play guitar; you'll find me at home strumming 'Vincent' on the guitar. I also read a lot of poetry, and Shakespeare was my first love, which was why I got into acting. A lot of the fighters are intelligent!
Acting is my first love.
I'm a musical theater guy. That's where I came from. That's where I go whenever I have the chance. It's my first love.
Acting is my first love, and that's my main career, it really is.
I liked football a lot, too, but basketball clearly is my first love.
Drums were my first instrument, my first love. I need rhythm, something that moves.

I often say poetry was my first love.
'Smallville' was my first love and it is always close to my heart.

Emilio Estevez was definitely my first love.
Music has always been my first love, and I appreciate how a great musician can bring awareness to tough issues through their work.
I don't know which was the first love - music or fashion.
Yes, yes, theater in general is just going to always be my first love, performing for a live audience.
Film is my first love. It wasn't something I intended to fall in love with, but I grew to love it.
Comedy is my first love; that's my main goal in life - to keep doing comedy.

Looking back, I got the bed I wanted and I lay in it. I didn't want to go to America. If you want to join that world, you have to go and live there, and that was something I could not have done. I am very much about family. It doesn't matter where I live, but I feel very needful of my people around me. Besides, theatre is my first love.
Musical theatre is my first love.
I'm not at my best when I'm not working - I'm certainly not at my happiest. Acting will always be my first love.

I've always just adored music. It's my first love, really. I admire and respect people in the music business. You really have to work hard and diligently. Sometimes actors can be lazy and get away with it, but you can't do that if you're a musician.

I mean, there's times to rock and roll, and I love that too. But I think my first love is acoustic music.
My first love is acting on stage. A sitcom is a hybrid of stage and film.

People may know me from films, but theater is my first love. I did about 35 plays before I even landed my first screen role. I'm very comfortable on stage, and theater is not something you can just wing.
My first love is producing.

For me, movies and television are interesting because they are the dominant storytelling form of our time. My first love will always be fiction, and especially novels, but I'm a writer... I write poetry and essays and criticism and I'd love to write a whole play, and sometimes I even write scripts.
Yes, I love poetry, both to read and to write it. A first love.
Cricket is my passion; it is my first love. So I will not act in my movies, as they will just be a side business for me.
Little Red Riding Hood was my first love. I felt that if I could have married Little Red Riding Hood, I should have known perfect bliss.

You know, your first album is about really amazing things. Your first album is always about coming of age, first love, first loss, usually you suffer a first loss of someone that you love to death, even, you know, really big life lessons, things you learn from your parents' divorce or from the travels that you took.

When everything happens to you when you're so young, you're very lucky, but by the same token, you're never going to have that same feeling again. The first time anything happens to you - your first love, your first success - the second one is never the same.
I love my mother. She's my first love. She has been through a lot and is a sole survivor.

I love acting. Acting is a true love of mine, acting and math. Although they are both creative, they use very different sides of your brain. And I love both. Acting is my first love, and that's my main career, it really is.

We think of first love as sweet and valuable, a blessed if hazardous condition.
My first love was singing. It was the first thing that really felt like it was a part of me. It's just in my blood. And acting came sort of out of singing because I did a lot of musical theater.

No one forgets their first love. You're experiencing all those endorphins and all that dopamine and that obsession with one another for the very first time in your life, so it makes it that much more cute.
She was my first love, and I loved her as only a boy loves.
A man always remembers his first love with special tenderness, but after that he begins to bunch them.

Videogames are probably my first love.
My first love was basketball.

Oh, well, my first love is comedy or singing and dancing.

Jazz was my first love.

Acting is my first love. There are still so many characters inside of me that are waiting to come out.

I suppose comedy is my first love, in a way.

Music is my first love.

Well I like everything but my first love has always been piano because when I started out there was a piano in my house and it was there so I just started tinkling on it really so it's always been my first love.

Music has always been my first love, so making music happen is a big priority of mine.

You have to look at the world, think about it in relationship to yourself, and say, 'I think this is a pattern,' or 'I think this is the way fatherhood works,' or 'I think this is the way first love feels.' The danger in that is, that's when you open yourself up to real critique.

I've been a musician since childhood, and music is my first love. I love it.
